section.name: Overview
section.p: Waterview is positioned as a highly componentized web application framework, which is an avalon standard and plexus container based, turbine 3 like servlet . Being similar to turbine 3, presentation logic is abstracted with action/page and http requests are handled with a componentized and pluggable pipeline in waterview. Page could be interpreted with componentized and plugable renderer. Currently waterview is using velocity and jelly as default page renderer. Componentized design allows developers to come up with their page renderers in an extremely simple way.
Waterview is under active development now. Any suggestion is welcom. Please feel free to shoot me email with your idea.

section.name: Waterview vs. Turbine
section.p: Componentization and avalon standard is the difference between waterview and turbine 3.

The pattern of waterview is borrowed from turbine 3 while the implementation makes huge difference. Both turbine and waterview is introducing a pluggable web application but waterview makes the way of configuring pipeline valves, error handler, page renderers and other components (services in turbine) unified and generic. In waterview, all these elements are components defined in xml file for plexus container.

Basically the intention of waterview is to make turbine more componentized and unified, eliminate the pipeline specific definition (pipeline xml), turbine specific configuration (TurbineResources.properties) and introduce avalon.
